string-array.name: prompts
string-array.item: How do I set boundaries and avoid absorbing someone else\'s emotions and stress? Boundaries are healthy and you should not hurt yourself to help someone emotionally
Do I forgive myself when I make a mistake? Remember, anyone can make a mistake because everyone is human :)
If I could do anything knowing I would not fail, what could I do?
If a genie granted me three wishes right now, what would I wish for?
What did I want to be when I grew up? In what ways did this vision change and in what way did this stay the same?
What goals do I hope to achieve in the short term?
What mistake did I learn the most from?
What scares me most about my future and why? What steps can I take to solve this?
What do you look forward to most in the future?
Imagine what your dream life would look like. What are some baby steps you can take to get closer to this life? Baby steps are still progress!
What new things would I like to learn? What do I believe is holding me back? Remember, growth is a process.
What is my goal today and how will I achieve it?
Have I ever accomplished a goal only to find out it wasn\'t fulfilling for me? What kind of goal was it?
When was the last time I accomplished a goal that made me feel good for a long time? What kind of goal was it?

string-array.name: prompts2
string-array.item: When was the last time I felt most like myself?
What am I still trying to prove about myself and why?
What is my heart telling me? What is my mind telling me?
Which one do I follow more: my heart or my head?
What am I trying not to think about?
How do I put myself first without feeling guilty? Remember, do not hurt yourself to help someone
When was the last time I felt really disappointed or hurt? What helped me overcome it?
When was the last time I solved a tough problem and what did I learn from it? Yes you have because you are determined :)
Do I find praise or criticism to be more motivating?
What was it that I never told someone and still regret not telling them?
How can I cope when things are not going my way?
Do I engage in negative self-talk? What are some ways I can practice self-love? You are worthy of love :)
How do I go about making difficult decisions in life?
Do I believe that the present is better than the past and why?
What are some of the anger and frustrations that I have been carrying? What are some ways I can solve them? Yes, you have the ability to solve them :)
Which emotion best represents me, and why?
Write a letter to who I feel hurt me the most. (You don’t have to give it to them, just release some of the feelings)
What can\’t I live without? Does this have a positive or negative impact on my life? If negative, how can I work towards reducing or removing its presence in my life?
What was the topic, idea, or concept so engaging to me that I lost track of time? Why does it captivate me?
Do I speak up when I feel I\’m not getting what I deserve?
How old or young do I feel inside? Why?
What am I most afraid of about life?
Do I have any regrets that I can\’t let go of? Why? It\’s ok to have them :)

string-array.name: prompts3
string-array.item: What is a moment I think back to for comfort?
How do I show empathy or that I care for others?
What strengths/traits do I value the most in a friendship?
What part of your day do you most look forward to?
Which part of your day causes you the most stress or discouragement? How can you overcome it?
Write a letter of forgiveness to someone (you don't need to give it to them).
What was an act of yours where you put others before yourself?
Write a letter to yourself on a bad day. Bad days happen and that's ok! What would you say to yourself on one of those days?
What is a bad habit that I have? It\’s ok to have them as everyone does :)
What is a bad habit that I have overcome?
What are some of my strengths?
How would you describe a day that would be perfect to you?
What are three short term goals I have?
What is the place I feel happiest?
What is the place I feel least happy? Try to identify why you feel this way here.

string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item: "Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts." — Winston S. Churchill
“Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.” — Will Rogers
“When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.” — Paulo Coelho
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” — Thomas Edison
“Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.” — Tony Robbins
“The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.” —Amelia Earhart
“The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.” —Amelia Earhart
“Remember, teamwork begins by building trust. And the only way to do that is to overcome our need for invulnerability.” — Patrick Lencioni
“I invite everyone to choose forgiveness rather than division, teamwork over personal ambition.” — Jean-Francois Cope
“I’d rather regret the things I’ve done than regret the things I haven’t done.” —Lucille Ball
“When you arise in the morning, think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love…” – Marcus Aurelius
“Inspiration does exist, but it must find you working.” —Pablo Picasso
“The only one who can tell you “you can’t win” is you and you don’t have to listen.” —Jessica Ennis
“Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.” —Albert Einstein
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —Mark Twain
“If you can't yet do great things, do small things in a great way.” ―Napoleon Hill
“The way you live your days is the way you live your life.” —Annie Dillard
"The reason we struggle with insecurity is because we compare our behind-the-scenes with everyone else’s highlight reel." —Steve Furtick
“If you don’t risk anything, you risk even more.” —Erica Jong
“Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.” — Henry Ford
“Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” — Confucius
“If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.” — Wayne Dyer
“We must reach out our hand in friendship and dignity both to those who would befriend us and those who would be our enemy.” — Arthur Ashe

string-array.name: quotes2
string-array.item: “It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.” — Bill Gates
“When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.” — Henry Ford
“We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.” — Aristotle
“Hustle beats talent when talent doesn’t hustle” – Ross Simmonds
“Never let success get to your head and never let failure get to your heart.” —Drake
“For the great doesn’t happen through impulse alone, and is a succession of little things that are brought together.” —Vincent van GoghThis is quote 1.0
“Resilience is when you address uncertainty with flexibility.” —Unknown
“It’s not the will to win that matters—everyone has that. It’s the will to prepare to win that matters.” —Paul Bryant
“True humility is not thinking less of yourself; it is thinking of yourself less.” — C.S. Lewis
“Courage is like a muscle. We strengthen it by use.” —Ruth Gordo
"More is lost by indecision than wrong decision.” —Marcus Tullius Cicero
“You can never leave footprints that last if you are always walking on tiptoe.” —Leymah Gbowee
“I choose to make the rest of my life the best of my life.” —Louise Hay
“Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.” ―Winston Churchill
If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough. –-Oprah Winfrey
Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else. —Margaret Mead
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant. —Robert Louis Stevenson
“We cannot solve problems with the kind of thinking we employed when we came up with them.” — Albert Einstein
“Learn as if you will live forever, live like you will die tomorrow.” — Mahatma Gandhi
“Stay away from those people who try to disparage your ambitions. Small minds will always do that, but great minds will give you a feeling that you can become great too.” — Mark Twain
“When you give joy to other people, you get more joy in return. You should give a good thought to happiness that you can give out.”— Eleanor Roosevelt
“When you change your thoughts, remember to also change your world.”—Norman Vincent Peale

string-array.name: quotes3
string-array.item: “It is only when we take chances, when our lives improve. The initial and the most difficult risk that we need to take is to become honest. —Walter Anderson
“Nature has given us all the pieces required to achieve exceptional wellness and health, but has left it to us to put these pieces together.”—Diane McLaren
"Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts." — Winston S. Churchill
"It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation." — Herman Melville
"The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same." — Colin R. Davis
“Success usually comes to those who are too busy looking for it.” — Henry David Thoreau
“Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.” —Dale Carnegie
“There are three ways to ultimate success: The first way is to be kind. The second way is to be kind. The third way is to be kind.” —Mister Rogers
“Success is peace of mind, which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you made the effort to become the best of which you are capable.” —John Wooden
“I never dreamed about success. I worked for it.” —Estée Lauder
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.” ―W. P. Kinsella
“The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty." — Winston Churchill
“Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.” — Will Rogers
“You learn more from failure than from success. Don’t let it stop you. Failure builds character.” — Unknown
“If you are working on something that you really care about, you don’t have to be pushed. The vision pulls you.” — Steve Jobs
“Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterwards.” ―Vernon Sanders Law
“To know how much there is to know is the beginning of learning to live.” —Dorothy West
“Goal setting is the secret to a compelling future.” — Tony Robbins
“Everything you can imagine is real!” — Pablo Picasso
"Fall seven times, stand up eight." – Japanese Proverb
"Sometimes the right path is not the easiest one." – Grandmother Willow, Pocahontas
“If you focus on what you left behind, you will never see what lies ahead.” – Gusteau, Ratatouille
"Never doubt yourself, it will only hold you back." – J.M. Barrie
